title: Pearson Sells Financial Times To Japan's Nikkei
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 23, 2015, 15:49 BST - UK Markets close in 41 mins. Pearson Sells Financial Times To Japan's Nikkei By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 4 minutes 30 seconds ago View Photo 

Financial Times owner Pearson (Xetra: 858266 - news ) has agreed to sell the newspaper to Japan's Nikkei for £844m, the companies said. 
The deal does not include the FT Group's 50% stake in The Economist magazine. 
Pearson had been exploring the possible sale of the FT for weeks, the newspaper reported on its website. 
Those previously mentioned as potential buyers included the German group Axel Springer, as well as Bloomberg,Thomson Reuters (Dusseldorf: TOC.DU - news ) and Buzzfeed, which denied any interest. 
Pearson had owned the FT for nearly 60 years. 
But the group's chief executive, John Fallon, said the best way to ensure the newspaper's journalistic and commercial success, in the current news environment, was for it to be part of a global, digital news company. 
Nikkei is the largest independent business media group in Asia, with flagship newspaper Nikkei as its core. 
Chairman and CEO Tsuneo Kita said he was "extremely proud" to team with the newspaper. 
The FT Group contributed £334m of sales and £24m of adjusted operating income last year, Pearson said.
